top something/somebody ↔ up.translation[: to add more liquid to a container that is partly full
I’ll just top up the coffee pot.
to put more drink in someone’s glass or cup after they have drunk some
to increase the level of something slightly so as to bring it back to the level you want
He had to do extra jobs at the weekend to top up his income.
an amount of liquid that you add to a glass, cup etc in order to make it full again
an extra payment that brings an amount to the desired level
to add to something in order to bring it up to the level you want
You can top up your pension contributions any time.
an extra amount added to something in order to bring it up to the level you want
Your bank may agree to provide the top-up needed to make a purchase possible.
